monthly_spend_analysis_data.ai_summary: Your total income for January was $2,345.67, primarily from retirement/pension. Your major expenses were groceries ($200.75, 8.6% of income), medical ($195, 8.3%), entertainment ($35.99, 1.5%), transportation ($65.3, 2.8%), and utilities ($89.99, 3.8%). Your total spending was $586.03 (25% of income). To achieve your goal of paying off student loans, consider reducing discretionary spending on entertainment and dining out. Look for opportunities to lower medical and transportation costs as well.

Your total income for February was $2,345.67, primarily from retirement or pension. Your major expenses were groceries ($181.77, 7.7% of income), restaurants ($75.50, 3.2%), general merchandise ($129.99, 5.5%), transportation ($65.00, 2.8%), and medical expenses ($165.99, 7.1%). Your total spending was $618.25, accounting for 26.3% of your income. To better manage your finances and achieve your goal of paying off student loans, consider reducing discretionary spending on dining out and shopping. Additionally, explore options to lower medical and utility costs. Consistently monitoring your expenses and sticking to a budget can help you allocate more funds towards debt repayment.

Your total income for March was $2,345.67, primarily from retirement/pension. Your major expenses were groceries ($140.57, 6% of income), utilities ($270, 11.5%), medical ($134.99, 5.8%), and entertainment ($25, 1.1%). Your total spending was $601.06 (25.6% of income). To achieve your goal of paying off student loans, consider reducing discretionary spending on dining out and entertainment. Look for opportunities to lower utility bills and explore income-boosting options.

Your total income for April was $2,345.67, primarily from retirement or pension. Your major expenses were groceries ($125.89), restaurants ($65.32), utilities ($205.67), and transportation ($42.15). While your spending on essentials like food and utilities seems reasonable, you could consider reducing discretionary expenses like dining out and entertainment to accelerate your goal of paying off student loans. Explore budgeting apps or automatic transfers to a dedicated savings account to boost your debt repayment efforts.

email_notifications.spending_summary_email: Your Monthly Financial Insights Are Ready!
email_notifications.coupons_email: Calling all beauty queens! Sarah, snag 15% off at Sephora with code BEAUTY15. Treat yourself while chipping away at those loans.
email_notifications.loans_email: Sarah, consolidate those pesky student loans with Chase's 6.99% - 19.99% APR personal loan. $3K - $35K to slay debt!
email_notifications.credit_cards_email: Level up your cash flow, Sarah! Citi Double Cash: $200 bonus after $1,500 spend. Perfect sidekick for your debt-slaying mission.
email_notifications.savings_email: Sarah, Marcus by Goldman Sachs is offering a sweet 4.30% APY! Stash cash here while crushing those student loans.
